title: dimReduction
text: vignette describes usage dimReduction parameter pandemonium app new functions can written .

title: dimReduction
text: mat = n x m matrix coordinates reduce dist = n x n distance matrix.

title: dimReduction
text: dimReduction(mat = mat, ist = dist)$Y = n x 2 matrix data frame dimension reduced coordinates

title: dimReduction
text: standard way write new function passed dimReduction wrapper common dimension reduction algorithm. defined function must able take mat dist parameters. one used best write function space additional parameters ... seen following example. algorithms may take dist object instead distance matrix. can done converting distance matrix using stats::.dist(). done umap.
code: tSNE_mat <- function(mat,...) {   coord_red = list()   coord_red$Y = Rtsne::Rtsne(mat)$Y   coord_red }  tSNE_dist <- function(dist,...) {   coord_red = list()   coord_red$Y = Rtsne::Rtsne(dist, is.dist = TRUE)$Y   coord_red }  newPandemonium(df, dim_reduction = list(tSNE_mat = tSNE_mat, tSNE_dist = tSNE_dist)) umap <- function(dist,...) {   ret <- list()   ret$Y <- uwot::umap(stats::as.dist(dist))   ret }  newPandemonium(df, dim_reduction = list(umap = umap))

title: getCoords
text: closure coordinate function returns user defined coordinate matrix passed closure called pandemonium call pandemonium(df, getCoords=list(user=userCoords(coordMatrix))). used variables removed space.

title: getCoords
text: function return single array size input df column names df.

title: getCoords
code: pullCoordsNoCov <- function(df, cov, exp, ...){    n <- nrow(df)   df <- as.matrix(df)   nc <- ncol(df)   coord_mat <- matrix(nrow = n, ncol = nc)    for (i in 1:n){     for (j in 1:nc){       coord_mat[i, j] <- as.numeric((df[i, j] - exp$value[j]) / sqrt(cov[j, j]))     }   }   colnames(coord_mat) <- colnames(df)   return(coord_mat) }  pandemonium(df,getCoords = list(pull = pullCoordsNoCov, normal = normCoords))

title: getScore
text: vignette describes usage getScore parameter pandemonium app. input function calculates scores bins plotted input panel can used colouring dimension reduction tour views. pandemonium package provides two functions scores one can created passed. two functions provided : chi2score calculate chi-squared values exp reference point space1. scores returned chi-squared values, bins sigma bins reference point interesting points ‘bf’, best fit ‘sm’, closet point origin. outsidescore function takes set scores point name score data outside app. passed loading app. scores returned scores passed , bins quartile bins score interesting points returned.

title: getScore
text: app pass following objects getScore may used calculations:

title: getScore
text: function return named list following entries used byt app.

title: getScore
text: simple template getScore function look like follows: function take values outside app, best write closure pass values calling app. done outsidescore seen :
code: myScore <- function(space1=rv$space1, cov=rv$cov1, covinv=rv$covInv1,          exp=rv$exp, space2=rv$space2, space2.cov=rv$cov2,           space2.exp=rv$space2.exp, k=rv$kC){      ## Calculations   n      <- nrow(space1)   scores <- #function to calculate scores   bins   <- #function to calculate scores      ## Return   ret <- list()   ret$score       <- scores   ret$scoreName   <- "scores"   ret$bins        <- bins   ret$binName     <- "bins"   ret$interest    <- rep("",n)   ret$is.interest <- which(ret$interest!="")   ret }  pandemonium(df, getScore = myScore) outsidescore <- function(scores,scoreName = NULL){   function(space1, ...){     ret <- list()     n<- nrow(space1)     ret$score <- scores     ret$bins <- cut(scores, stats::quantile(scores,c(0,0.25,0.75,1))-c(1,0,0,0), labels=c("lower","inner","upper"))     ret$interest <- rep("",n)     ret$is.interest <- which(ret$interest!="")     ret$scoreName <- as.character(scoreName)     ret$binName   <- "quartile"     ret   } }  pandemonium(df = Bikes$space1, space2 = Bikes$space2,                  getScore = outsidescore(Bikes$other$res,"Residual"))

Two small differences input function follows. CovInv specified space. Coordinate functions passed named list instead functions passed getCoordsSpace1 getCoordsSpace2.

what: High Dimensional Analysis In Linked Spaces
title: High Dimensional Analysis In Linked Spaces
text: pandemonium performs hierarchical cluster analysis within Shiny GUI. data space split two parts, example input variables latent variables statistical model. Clustering performed using subset variables clustering space, cluster assignments also visualised linked space. Within dynamic GUI pandemonium performs data preparation, clustering visualisation interactive methods. user can change settings without leave GUI.

title: High Dimensional Analysis In Linked Spaces

title: High Dimensional Analysis In Linked Spaces
text: use Bikes data example show app can used. load GUI data, following can used. loading app clustering space df linked space space2 data automatically selected data page. pressing load app launch analysis tab. Within analysis tab can explore different visuals options enclosed tabs.
code: library(pandemonium) pandemonium(df = Bikes$space1, space2 = Bikes$space2,                  getScore = outsidescore(Bikes$other$res,"Residual"))

code: file<-tempfile() writeResults(space1 = Bikes$space1, space2 = Bikes$space2, settings = list(metric="euclidean",linkage="ward.D2",k=4), filename = file) file.remove(file) #> [1] TRUE
